Name: Bangui
Description: Bangui is the capital and the largest city of the Central African Republic. It serves as the political, economic, and cultural hub of the country.

Name: Bamingui-Bangoran
Description: Located in the northeast of the country, this region is known for its natural landscapes and wildlife, including parts of the Bamingui-Bangoran National Park.

Name: Bassoko
Description: Bassoko is a region with a mix of tropical forests and savannas. Agriculture is an important activity in the region.

Name: Haute-Kotto
Description: This region is located in the eastern part of the country and is home to diverse ethnic groups and significant forest resources.

Name: Mambéré-Kadéï
Description: Mambéré-Kadéï is located in the southwestern part of the country, known for its agricultural activities, particularly cattle farming.

Name: Mbomou
Description: Mbomou is a region located in the southeastern part of the country, known for its biodiversity and proximity to the Democratic Republic of the Congo border.

Name: Nané-Mambéré
Description: Located in the central region, this area is home to various ethnic groups and abundant wildlife.

Name: Ouaka
Description: Ouaka is a central region, home to the country s rich biodiversity and agricultural resources. The region is relatively forested.

Name: Ouham
Description: Ouham is located in the northwest and is an important region for agriculture, especially cassava and maize.

Name: Sangha-Mbaere
Description: Sangha-Mbaéré is located in the southwestern part of the country. The region is known for its tropical rainforests and rich wildlife.
